_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up 

this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Delicato Vineyards Manteca has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Delicato Vineyards Manteca, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Delicato Vineyards Manteca (DVM) has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name                      | Process Chemical              | Process Quantity(lbs.)     | Covered Regulations

Refrigeration Plant 2               Anhydrous Ammonia               3,300 (connected to RP 7)    RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)

Refrigeration Plant 5               Anhydrous Ammonia               18,000                       RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)

Refrigeration Plant 7               Anhydrous Ammonia               8,700 (connected to RP 2)    RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)

Refrigeration Plant 8               Anhydrous Ammonia               26,000                       RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)

Refrigeration Plant 11              Anhydrous Ammonia

17,000                       RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)

Refrigeration Plant 14              Anhydrous Ammonia               34,000                       RMP/PSM/CalARP (P3)



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Descriptions



Delicato Family Vineyards Manteca - operates a processing facility for wine in Manteca, CA. The facility has (6) RMP covered ammonia refrigeration systems that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:



Refrigeration Plant 2

(2) Wine Chillers



Refrigeration Plant 5

(1) Wine Chiller

(16) Wine Tanks

(2) Glycol Chillers



Refrigeration Plant 7

(31) Wine Tanks



Refrigeration Plant 8

(153) Wine Tanks



Refrigeration Plant 11

(1) Wine Chiller

(84) Wine Tanks



Refrigeration Plant 14

(72) Wine Tanks



The wine chillers are equipped with shell and tube heat exchangers and accumulators as required for flooded operation. The wine tanks are supplied by a liquid recirculator as required for a pumped overfeed operation. The Glycol Chillers are equipped with plate and frame heat exchangers and are supplied high pressure liquid as required for a direct expansion o

peration. 



The refrigeration machinery is contained within each outdoor machinery area. A partial list of system components includes:



Refrigeration Plant 2

(1) Reciprocating compressors

(1) Screw compressors

(2) Oil separators

(2) Shell and tube 

(1) High pressure receiver

(1) Evaporative Condenser



Refrigeration Plant 5

(2) Screw Compressors

(1) Reciprocating Compressor

(3) Oil Separators

(1) High Pressure Receiver

(2) Evaporative Condensers

(2) Plate and Frame Heat Exchangers

(1) Transfer Vessel

(1) Low Pressure Receiver

(3) Ammonia Pumps

(1) Oil Pot

(1) Emergency Pressure Crossover System

(1) Diffusion Tank



Refrigeration Plant 7

(1) Screw Compressor

(1) Oil Separator

(1) Low Pressure Receiver

(2) Ammonia Pumps

(1) Oil Pot

(1) High Pressure Receiver

(1) Evaporative Condenser



Refrigeration Plant 8

(1) Screw Compressor

(1) Reciprocating Compressor

(2) Oil Separators

(1) Low Pressure Receiver

(2) Ammonia Pumps

(1) Oil Pot

(2) High Pressure Receivers

(1) Evaporative Condenser

(1) Plate and Frame



Refrigeration Plant 11

(3) Screw Compressors

(3) Oil Separators

(1) Shell and Tube

(1) Low Pressure Receiver

(2) Ammonia Pumps

(1) Oil Pot

(1) Transfer Vessel

(1) High Pressure Receiver

(2) Evaporative Condensers

(1) Diffusion Tank



Refrigeration Plant 14

(4) Screw Compressors

(4) Oil Separators

(1) Low Pressure Receiver

(2) Ammonia Pumps

(1) Oil Pot

(1) High Pressure Receiver

(2) Evaporative Condensers

(1) Emergency Pressure Crossover System

(1) Diffusion Tank



Refrigeration Plant 2 operate as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to the wine chillers where it passes through an expansion valve and into the shell and tube heat exchanger. Low temperature liquid circulates through the heat exchanger and as heat is absorbed the liquid vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas. The residual liquid is separated from the gas in the accumulator and the gas is piped to t

he suction inlet on the compressors. The compressors elevates the temperature and pressure of the gas and discharges it to the condensers where the gas is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver.



Refrigeration Plant 5 and 11 operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped through a series of liquid feed solenoid valves, an expansion valve, and into a liquid recirculator. From there, low pressure liquid is pumped to each of the wine tanks, where it passes through a solenoid valve, hand expansion valve and into the jacket of the wine tank. Low temperature liquid circulates through the jacket. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which passes through an isolation valve and is returned to the liquid recirculator. The residual liquid is separated from the gas in the recirculator and the gas is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to a water cooled evaporative condenser where the high pressure gas ammonia is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver. In addition, high pressure liquid is pipe to the heat exchangers where it passes through an expansion valve and into the heat exchangers as a low temperature and low pressure liquid. As heat is absorbed by the liquid it vaporizes into a low pressure and temperature gas. The gas is piped to the suction inlet of the compressors. The gas temperature and pressure is elevated and discharged into the condensers where the gas is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver.



Refrigeration Plant 7, 8 and 14 operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped through a series of liquid feed solenoid valves, an expansion valve, and into a liquid recirculator. From there, low pressure liquid is pumped to each of the wine tanks, where it passes through a solenoid v

alve, hand expansion valve and into the jacket of the wine tank. Low temperature liquid circulates through the jacket. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which passes through an isolation valve and is returned to the liquid recirculator. The residual liquid is separated from the gas in the recirculator and the gas is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to a water cooled evaporative condenser where the high pressure gas ammonia is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver.



Each system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point. 



Each ammonia refrigeration system at Delicato Family Vineyards Manteca consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, each refrigeration system at Delicato Family Vineyards Manteca is treated as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Delicato Vineyards Manteca has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration processes. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Delicato Vineyards Manteca facility is an

integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 126,000 (LBS). It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

 

1.4 Five Year Accident History



1.4.1 Anhydrous Ammonia Accidental Releases



During the last five years, there has not been an ammonia accident which caused injuries, or other known offsite/onsite deaths, property damage, environmental damage, sheltering in place or evacuations.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Delicato Vineyards Manteca's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- Cal/OSHA's Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38

- Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 8 CCR ?5189(n)

- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]- Title 29 CFR ?1910.119(n)

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 ?2765.1-2765.2

- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 40 CFR ?68.95

- California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures] - Title 19 CC

R, Division 2, Chapter 4 ?2731

- California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

- Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Select Delicato Manteca employees receive HAZWOPER, First Responder Operations (FRO) training for the purpose of responding defensively to an emergency involving hazardous materials prior to evacuating. However, since Delicato Manteca does not provide Hazmat Technician Training and has not developed a full Offensive Hazmat Technician Team, these employees are subject to the policies and procedures of the responding emergency response agency if a Hazmat Team is required. It is assumed that the policies and procedures of the responding agency would be consistent with the requirements of HAZWOPER regulations.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Delicato Vineyards Manteca has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Delicato Vineyards Manteca continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Delicato Vineyards Manteca's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Delicato Vineyards Manteca's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Delicato Vineyards Manteca has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or pa

st due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Delicato Vineyards Manteca has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Delicato Vineyards Manteca now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Delicato Vineyards Manteca employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Delicato Vineyards Manteca will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
